intro: Populus pamirica var. trichorachis, commonly known as the Pamir poplar, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive leaves, which are lanceolate and often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant typically grows in cold, high-altitude environments, demonstrating a high degree of adaptability to harsh conditions. Its bark is smooth and grayish, and it produces small, catkin-like flowers in the spring. This variety plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife.
